website_summaries.verdict: A high-end machine that can tackle both sewing and quilting. Perfect for anyone who wants to take on ambitious projects.
pros: Runs at an impressive speed of up to 1,500 stitches per minute
Offers 4 feed dog settings for optimum fabric control
The 12" x 18" extension table makes quilting a breeze
Features automatic needle threading, thread trimming, and needle positioning
cons: Not the most affordable model out there

customer_reviews.title: this sewing machine is great. Oh
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the right choice of sewing machine. The large area throat plate makes it much easier to sew large quilts. My little brother sewing machine I just use for appliqué projects since big brother only has the straight stitch. The needle does unthread often (I think the thread cutter cuts a bit short.). The needle threader on this machine I have never been able to master yet. The one on my little machine is simple. Other than that, this sewing machine is great. Oh, one more thing, you can't tell when your bobbin is low on thread. I'm glad I chose this sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: The best machine I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is so easy to use! The bobbin winder stops automatically when the bobbin is full, love that!! It has plenty of room for large quilt projects! I have had mine for almost a month and have already made a queen size quilt and quilted a few runners and lap size and full size quilts!! Love it! This is my 4th and probably my last sewing machine! I received this as a 60th birthday gift from my hubby and I am thrilled with it!!
customer_reviews.author: J Delany

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good deal on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably good deal on Amazon. I ordered yesterday when price was the lowest I’ve ever seen. I received it today! I have been sewing and free motion quilting on it all day. It’s an amazing industrial straight stitch machine. I have plenty of fluffy top of the line machines but the pq1500 SL is the best for straight line and free motion quilting. It’s all I need coupled with my serger from now on! Amazing machine. Oh, if you want this machine you need to keep checking on Amazon as the price fluctuates. Once I saw it drop real low.....I pounced and bought it :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Livingstone

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for starters and quilting.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy for quilting! Flipped thru the starter guide for about 10 min then started quilting!! I just started sewing in Feb ( 3 months ago!). Great walking foot; almost all metal and nearly silent!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A.

customer_reviews.title: And though she be but little, she is fierce.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a little powerhouse. I have had mine for five years now and it still works like the day I got it. I have a Singer featherweight and a small Janome that I use for mending and small sewing projects, but I use this one for quilting and piecing and it has never let me down. I have made table runners and queen size quilts with all over free motions quilting and it does the job beautifully. For the price, this machine cannot be beaten. No bells or whistles on this, but I’ve not found that I’ve needed either. Happy sewing!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't sewed quilts yet, I'm very excited to use it for them! but I made some aprons and several bags I was debating on this or an industrial I'm sooo glad I chose this machine I can sew several layers of vinyl I think 8? it glides right through like butter; the motor is quiet and purrs!! the knee lever is nice I need to use it more! I love that it cuts the thread!!!! I also love how you can adjust the thickness from sheer to vinyl so easy! this is the BEST machine I have ever had!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This machine
customer_reviews.text: I make bags and other crafts, as well as some quilting. Everyone raves about and insists on the Juki, but I just could not justify the price (approx double this machine). This machine is AWESOME. It is perfect for all I do. Sews through layers like a boss and tackles mesh and other tricky fabrics. So glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sew sew happy with this machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first product review I have ever left! That tells you how much I am enjoying this machine! When I unpacked it the bobbin was full and loaded. I threaded the machine (the needle threaded perfectly!) and started sewing! I have been doing piecing without a single glitch! I have put together 2 rows of quilt as you go blocks and haven’t run out of bobbin thread yet! I love the thread cutter and the knee lifter! I thought that would be hard to get used to but I’ve only had the machine for 2 days and I can’t imagine sewing without those! I will leave another review when the honeymoon is over! :)
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive any instructions with this machine on how to operate or even how to thread it. It looks like it would be a good machine , but is useless to me without the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B.

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this machine! It's strong, it's precise, it quilts beautifully, the bobbin winder is great, and I can use my magnetic super light on it. If this machine had zigzag capability it would be The Perfect Machine. However, the cover is only good as a dustcover. I wish there was a hard case for carrying and storage.
customer_reviews.author: eirrac

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty industrial machine. Great for straight stitching
customer_reviews.text: This machines is great for the quilter that needs straight stitches. It can do free motion quilting. It’s a fast powerful machine. It is a heavy machine. I would not suggest it for a beginner because it’s to fast. It is easy to use because there are not a lot of bells and whistles. The only thing I wished Brother would have added was something to tell us you have a low bobbin. Then it would have been the perfect machine for my use because a quilter hates to find out the bobbin has ran out and they didn’t know it after sewing for a bit
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Potts

customer_reviews.title: It's an elegant beast!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before testing one and am I happy! I was never able to sew at super slow speed on my 50-year-old machine. This sewing machine is easy to use at slow and fast speeds and is so accurate. And the thread cutter - I've died and gone to heaven. So for me, this was like going from a Yugo to a Mercedes Benz.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! Just what I needed to take my quilting to the next level. I purchased this machine because I wanted to experiment with free motion quilting on larger quilt sizes easier than my machine could comfortably handle. The larger throat allows for easier movement and adjusting while fmq. Powerful, speedy, smooth sewing.....a dream to sew with.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch straight stitch machine
customer_reviews.text: A very high-quality high-speed straight-stitch machine. Made out of metal, not plastic. With proper maintenance probably last a lifetime and then some. Once I started using the knee lever, there is no going back to the old method of raising the foot.
customer_reviews.author: nuke

customer_reviews.title: Tension issues are unbearable!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very difficult to work with. I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela hall

customer_reviews.title: JUNK! DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Never got to use the sewing machine as the bobbin will not come out of the machine. I have not been able to sew a single stitch. The hand wheel is difficult to turn and makes a grinding noise. I took the machine to a sewing machine shop, (a friend of mine) and he told me that it would take a complete overhaul to repair the machine. Please do not buy this piece of junk. BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fay

customer_reviews.title: I would be in love with this machine if the bobbin wasn't so difficult to change.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because of the throat size. I make quilts and needed a machine that could handle sewing larger quilts. The only thing I don't like is the type of bobbin holder it has and where they placed the bobbin holder. It is on the side of the machine and it is very difficult to get your hand in to place the bobbin holder. It is also very difficult to see what you are doing. All of my other Brother machines have a drop in bobbin which makes changing the bobbin so easy to do. I don't understand why they chose the bobbin placement that they did on this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C 5586

customer_reviews.title: Good sewing machine, not beginner or free motion friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Not great for free motion quilting and on then picky side. Originally had constant issues then I found the tension spring was rubbing against the frame causing my tension issues! With that fixed this has became a good sewing machine though still has trouble handling free motion quilting. It does however piece quilt tops together well so long as I feed it the correct thread (nylon).
customer_reviews.author: The Robinsons

customer_reviews.title: Great quilting machine
customer_reviews.text: After much looking, reading, and talking to knowledgeable people, this seemed to be the perfect solution. To date I have completed a couple of quilts which were waiting in the pile. The items I like most are the large work area, the speed you can quilt, the wonderful walking foot, the included feet, and the stability in general of the machine. The items I am not enjoying as much are the bobbin is a bit hard to get to if you have large hands, the foot pedal can be touchy, the is not a cruise control, and the bobbin runs empty without warning. Overall, it was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, A wonderful machine.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine, its the perfect machine for bag making. It sews on vinyl pretty well, as long as you adjust the feed dogs and presser foot presure. I also bought a teflon foot for it so it glides over the vinyl. It does have its limitations but it has so far worked out better than my singer heavy duty. I made this wallet with minimal skipped stitches, every now and then it did but I forgot to switch the feed dog dial and presser foot presure.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I love it for sewing strips
customer_reviews.text: I love my new machine! I can free motion quilt as well as make quick work of piecing. I love it for sewing strips. The only con: I wish the bobbin were larger. I get several ready before doing a project, but I do wish each one would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: KelH

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I am working on quilting my second quilt with this machine and I LOVE IT! It works great and quilts faster than I expected. I quilted a baby quilt in an hour! Wish I had found it a long time ago! 10/6/2015 Still loving this machine! I did have to make a small repair on the machine, which I did myself after locating a place to download the service manual. I was in the middle of quilting a quilt with a deadline on it and didn't have time to stop and take it for service. Working fine after the repair. I have now quilted 5 quilts of varying sizes with it and am very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Loves Books!

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in warehouse items
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this machine to replace machine that was delivered to me not working. This one appears to work however, it smells like cigarette smoke and there are 3 bobbins, two screwdrivers and feed pin missing. I am really disappointed that amazon warehouse does not check the items they send out to be as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this machine - was looking at Juki’s but this one had the features that suited my needs at a great price. I’ve been sewing for 40+ years - have transitioned from home decor and clothing to now crafting and quilting - this machine is a great addition to my regular sewing machines, embroidery machine and serger. I don’t want a machine that can “do it all”. This is my quilting only machine and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: RSU

customer_reviews.title: Pedal stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Brother PQ1500SL for just two months (I do not use it often). I was really happy with it but the pedal stopped working. It works intermittently! I have looked for a solution online and nothing seems to work. I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Makes quilting so much easier and smoother. Very easy to use. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this because mine didn't work properly. Also, be warned, this machine is VERY heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Elise B

customer_reviews.title: So far great, handles the layers well and has plenty of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far great, handles the layers well and has plenty of room for a rolled up king size, plus, quilt to move through it. Wanted a simple straight stitch machine, got it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sewwww Good!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you! I bought this, as an artist, with my BFA future soft sculptures and wall hangings in mind, but am presently using it for mask making, while the pandemic is ongoing and I am out of class. I used a similar machine in my sculpture class to create a 3-D soft sculpture (this was an accommodation for woodworking class) and found the brother machine to be great. This new machine ploughs through multiple layers of fabric like nothing, and the possibilities are endless. I am intrigued to think of what I might be able to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sally B. Goode

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine. I used it for quilting my quilt tops. Unfortunately its stopped working after 2 weeks. Had to return
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My sweet new ride!
customer_reviews.text: OMG...best purchase ever. And I buy a lot of stuff from Amazon...seriously the best....I am a professional textile artist, and this machine, for me, is like going from a humble Honda to a freakin' Ferrari! Smooth, fast, quiet, and just the cool amount of gizmos to make it fun...knee lift, auto thread cutter, wonderful selection of presser feet, and off I go. The muscle memory for using the knee lift and thread cutter has already kicked in, much like learning to shift gears in a vehicle...once you get it, you don't even have to think about it, it just happens. Yep, I'm in love here....
customer_reviews.author: BBell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine To be a back up when my computerized machine ends up in the shop for a long time. I got frustrated because of the lack of control in electronica machines. It’s the very basic straight stitch sewing. I love it back to basics. Very sturdy . Only drawback is the needle threader does not work initially did but it doesn’t thread anymore it is not worth sending it back just for that even though I did buy the extra warranty.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Missing a part
customer_reviews.text: I totally researched this product before I bought it. I have a small brother machine and I have always thought Brother was the BEST... I purchased this machine because it is quick and powerful. I cannot give this a 5 STAR because I am missing the Knee Lifter which is one of the reasons I purchased it. How can I get this part. I don't want to pay for something that should have been included in the purchase. I'm thinking about sending the whole machine back but I totally love it and don't want to wait for a new one. BROTHER please show you are the BEST IN SEWING and send me my knee lifter...PLEASE
customer_reviews.author: Ida Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best machine for piecing and quilting
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a dream!! I love how great it sews, the needle threader, needle down and thread cutter features are awesome. The sewing table and ability to get to the bobbin without having to remove it is the best feature! This is not a cheap machine and is heavy but not too heavy. As a quilter this has been the best investment in a sewing machine I have made yet and I anticipate many years of use on this machine!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Whitecotton

customer_reviews.title: This machine is a work horse : )
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a work horse that I will use for quilting and making curtains. I have been using it for quilting, straight stitching, and free motion quilting. (You will need to order some accessories for free motion quilting, and a walking foot to use for quilting with this machine.) There are plenty of videos online to help you out. The only thing I don't like about the machine is that the bobbin doesn't hold much thread. Knowing that though, I just make sure to wind a few bobbins in advance so I don't have to keep stopping to wind bobbins.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gauldin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, solid machine
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this machine! If you are new to sewing, this machine could be intimidating. It is not a light weight matching .. also it is a straight stitch machine which means just that. Only sees straight. Which is great for me, if you want a decorative stitching then this machine isn't for you unless you have more machines with the stitches you want or need. I love this machine and it's great for quilting.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Cash

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to thread
customer_reviews.text: Just received my machine yesterday. I was so excited. Set it up within 10-15 minutes! Very easy to thread. So far so good. I was sewing tonight with no issues. Can't wait to try some FMQ. Only downfall I see right now is not knowing if the bobbin is running low or out. Very happy with this machine. Will update later if I notice anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: hard to thread, but smooth stitching
customer_reviews.text: After using a Husqvarna for 30 years, I bought the Brother 1500 to do quilting. I have used the Brother for 3 1/2 months almost every day. It sews smoothly, very straight stitches, easy to change presser feet and adjust for variety of sewing and quilting. I especially like the walking and free motion feet. However, top and bobbin threading are very picky and hard to do. The bobbin placement is difficult to reach. The instruction manual provides minimal information compared to the one the Husky came with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The only thing I dislike is the bobbin is hard to remove. But this machine sews beautiful, even stitches & takes on multiple fabric layers like a champ. I have several sewing machines and for quilting this one gets 5* stars. It doesn't bounce around but is easy to move to where you want it. The table extension makes processing heavy quilt layers a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JIM  Love it
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed this same mach from a friend, After 6mo's of use I bought my own. This is a great mach . Many projects done in leather and this mach is a tough . AA+++ mar 2014 it's now may 2017 and this machine is great . Just clean &oil works like a fine watch. has made over 100 queen sized quilts . In these days of (not made to good ) this machine has passed all of the tests. I hope the new model will continue this trait.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and top notch quality.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about the Brother PQ 1500 SL. Besides being smooth and quite ,the extension table and boat load of accessories are first class. It can be a speed demon if needed or can just lope along easily when you expect plenty of finesse. It is a single stitch only machine that I purchased to match up with my computerized Brother to make hundreds of face masks. I keep to clean, oiled and dust free and change the needle every couple of days. I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Used for business so it sees a lot of hours
customer_reviews.text: I am so freaking impressed with this sewing machine! It's fast and very reliable, easy to care for and sturdy. I have no idea why I waited this long to invest in a machine like this. Did a lot of research and believe me you will not regret getting this if you do a variety of sewing, not just quilting which it is definitely good for. Used for business so it sees a lot of hours.
customer_reviews.author: ahippieadventure

customer_reviews.title: Might marry this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the first sewing machine I've owned that was made inside of the last 20 years, and it sews like a dream. I've been working on improving my quilting abilities and this machine is so smooth, fast, and accurate. I love the thread cutter and the extra long attachable table. The machine also comes with a ton of accessories specifically for quilting, like a walking foot, which is an excellent bonus. Machines seem to have gotten more complicated to thread over the years, but it was intuitive once I read the instructions a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I can do everything I can do on my standard domestic... so why do I need this machine then?! I expected this to be stronger and tougher but it really isn't. Struggled and struggled to complete project hoping it was just me and settings but not! Unfortunately it is too late to return so I may just sell it!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Free motion quilting
customer_reviews.text: I'm quilt instructor from hawaii , I tried this machine, this is good machine and free motion quilting is awesome!! So I introduce my student, Several people already bought from Amazon. Com. Thank you!! I really enjoy with machine.
customer_reviews.author: kyong anguay

customer_reviews.title: Quality machine
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to set up with the quick start guide. Perfect stitches out of the box. Love the automatic thread cutter. Probably not for the beginner sewer. Heavy and stable on the sewing table.....will be taking a lighter machine when I travel. Using this machine mainly for quilting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a winner
customer_reviews.text: Brother machines are topnotch. Packaging was beautiful, shipping was speedy and the purchase price was beyond compare. My local sewing store, where I had a Babylock picked out (same machine except for a red stripe on the side), wanted double; and he went so far as to tell me to buy this Brother quick. He could not come close to a price match. So far, it's sewing beautifully, threading is easy and the accessories are great basics. Any optional are easy to find. Now, if I could just get better at this free motion quilting, I would be ecstatic!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer gator

customer_reviews.title: Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome piece of hardware. Anything I would state has already been said except for this: Nobody makes a sewing machine bag/totes big enough for this machine, but I found a substitute that works.
customer_reviews.author: MAJF

customer_reviews.title: Dream come true
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. I’m worth it. Thanks, me ❤️
customer_reviews.author: MagDelish

customer_reviews.title: Lots of extras, fast and quiet machine.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that I waited to give the review because I have had time to practice on my machine. It is very quiet and fast. At first the thread cutter did not cut right and I would have to pull up the bobbin thread or just manually cut the thread, but after “reading the directions” I was able to fix that so no problem anymore. Cutter works great. Don’t forget step 4 (Pass thread through the quick bobbin thread device) Comes with many extras like walking foot, free motion foot and extended table. The needle threader is great to have. Enjoying and still learning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this machine for the most part for the type of sewing I do! I just wish it had a free arm for doing circular items like cuffs!! Also, after using the auto thread cutter, quite often with the next stitching, the needed comes unthreaded with the first stitch and I have to stop and rethread the needle! Quite annoying!! I make purses and totes, many out of re-cycled jeans and sew most everyday, so it certainly gets used!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very  happy  with  this  purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. I use it exclusively for free-motion quilting. I have had it for about a year and am very happy with the way it goes smoothly and super fast. I used it right out of the box and the stitches were perfect. I can't afford a Janome or baby lock and this was very inexpensive, especially considering the quality of this machine. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return
customer_reviews.text: Tried several times to use this and it keeps getting stuck. I thought it was me, but again and again it continues to knot up, not even an inch in.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Schoen

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MACHINE WITH EXCEPTION OF 2 FEATURES
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine with the exception of 2 features. When I use the automatic cutter the thread is so short that it comes right out of the needle and I have to rethread the needle almost every time and it is a real pain. So, I don't use the feature much and that was one of the features that sold me on the machine. Secondly, the bobbin is so hard to get to that I cringe when the bobbin runs out. I can hardly get my hand in place to snap the bobbin in and I have small hands. Other than those 2 things I love the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Delores J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Machine not usable as is
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to using this machine, unfortunately a few days after I received the sewing machine, I had a family emergency and had to fly out of state. Now that I'm able to take time and have prepared my quilt to finally be able to use the machine, the guide pin is stuck, the bobbin winding clutch is loose and I'm unable to use the sewing machine at all.
customer_reviews.author: D Hudson

customer_reviews.title: stitching is bad
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get this machine. The machine can not take 3 to 4 thicknesses of quilting cotton without skipping stitches. I have sewn for many many years and I am unable to solve the problem. Have had the machine for 6 weeks and I'm returning it. This should not be happening.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D.

customer_reviews.title: nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have used regular sewing machines for years. I never had any trouble sitting this up, easy to operate. I just had to check the book a few times, which was explained very well. I have always been a hand quilter, but since I have arthritis in my wrist, it is getting hard. Of course, the stitch doesn't match hand quilting, but it is still good. Comes with all the attachments that I need. No regrets buying this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Jan

customer_reviews.title: Good high-speed straight stitch machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a good machine for high-speed straight stitching. However, I had ordered it with the idea of mounting it on a quilting frame. Since there is no needle-up needle-down button on the machine, it did not work well for that (I couldn't reach the flywheel from the front of the quilt frame).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for quilting!
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between this machine and the more expensive Janome 6500. This machine is everything I need -- wonderfully sturdy, sturdy feet as well, lots of space -- really more of a mid-arm sewing machine. I've just sewn a twin-size quilt, start to finish, on this machine, without the thread or needle breaking once. The bobbin capacity is very small, so buy some extra bobbins for this model. Excellent value for the Amazon price!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Wheels

customer_reviews.title: The best machine for piecing and quilting
customer_reviews.text: The best machine for piecing and quilting. It is quiet and very stable on whatever surface it sits on. By far, my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Fitzer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS MACHINE. I have had sewing machines, but this beauty surpassed all them. i love that it quick sews and has a needle threader. I got this for my business and i absolutely love it. Havent had one problem with it. It helps me make money quickly.(quilting business)
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne G.

customer_reviews.title: K.P.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is easy to use. Fast. Bobbin size is great. I have been using this machine so much Awesome Awesome Awesome
customer_reviews.author: karla piala

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn how to use.
customer_reviews.text: A real work horse. I do miss the speed control and the needle up feature that I have on my small Brother machine.
customer_reviews.author: Cathi in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing heavy duty sewing machine for reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I love the 1500SL; as a quilter and bag maker I was looking for a machine with a larger throat space. I didn't need or want embroidery or fancy stitching. This machine rocks! And made it obtainable for my budget. Looking forward to a lasting relationship with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: April Strano

customer_reviews.title: Love my new machine.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at this machine for several months. A couple of days before Christmas my husband told me to order it as my Christmas present. I ordered the machine on Monday and received it the next day. On Christmas night I tried out the machine. It worked great straight out of the box. I have since made a baby quilt and am working on a small whole cloth quilt. I really like how it sews. Also having a bigger throat area makes the quilting of the quilt much easier. I am so glad I got my machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine for straight stitch quilting. Heavy duty. Auto threader is a learning curve which I have not yet mastered.

product_meta.title: Brother PQ1500SL Sewing and Quilting Machine, Up to 1,500 Stitches Per Minute, Wide Table, 7 Included Feet
product_meta.description:
Style Name:PQ1500SL w/ LCD Light

The Brother PQ1500SL quilting and sewing machine is a fantastic machine that belongs in the sewing room of every serious quilter and seamstress. The PQ1500SL is a high-speed straight stitching machine that produces lightning-fast sewing up to 1,500 stitches per minute. It also features a push-button automatic thread trimmer that allows you to save time without compromising the quality of your sewing projects. The inclusion of a built-in needle threader makes threading simple and time-saving.

The Brother PQ1500SL quilting and sewing machine also features an adjustable pin feed mechanism that allows you to exchange the use of the feed dogs for a single pin that cleanly extends from beneath the machine. This moves all layers of your quilt together or moves a delicate velvet without leaving feed dog marks in the nap. Four additional feed dog settings allow for maximum fabric control, while a knee lifter and bed extension table are added for quilting.

The Brother PQ1500SL also features a full range foot pressure adjustment and an automatic thread cutter with a fast. needle threader – which is a huge time-saving convenience. This machine is additionally backed by a 25-year limited warranty with free technical phone support for the life of the product.

Stitch Length (mm): 5, Stitch Width (mm): 7, UL/CSA Listed Voltage: 110v, Lighting Type : LED.
feature_bullets: 1,500 Stitches per minute max sewing speed: Maximum stitching of up to 1,500 stitches per minute allows you to sew and quilt more in less time

Advanced needle threading system: This sewing and quilting machine includes an automatic needle threader that perfectly pushes thread through the needle and a convenient, jam resistant drop-in top bobbin

Included accessories: The PQ1500SL longarm sewing and quilting machine comes with a wide table, 7 sewing feet, knee-lifter, instruction manual and more. The removable knee-lifter enables you to lift your presser foot with your knee, leaving both hands free for fabric handling
Precision pin feeding system: It's so easy to sew a wide variety of fabric thicknesses thanks to Brother's Pin Feed system for precision fabric feeding
At your side support: The PQ1500SL quilting and sewing machine comes with Brother At your side support offering free technical support via online, live chat or phone for the life of your machine
